para: After being loaded in, medical images can be manipulated in a variety of ways with AMIDE. An important point to remember is that AMIDE deals with all medical images as 3 or 4 dimensional data sets. While 2D slices from the the data set are displayed on the computer screen, at no time does AMIDE handle images as anything less than 3 dimensional data.

sect1.title: Displaying a Data Set
sect1.para: When initially loaded into the program, a data set is not displayed on the canvases. Rather, the name of the data set is contained in the study list, and the user needs to select the data set in the study list so that it is displayed on the canvases.

sect2.title: Displaying Multiple Data Sets
sect2.para: Displaying multiple data sets is as simple as importing more than one data set, and then selecting the data sets that you wish to view from the study list.
